content: On October 7, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced the Pittsburgh Pirates in Game 7 of the National League Championship Series. The Braves, who had not won a pennant since moving to Atlanta, secured a thrilling 1-0 victory, with Tom Glavine delivering an outstanding performance on the mound, allowing just one hit over eight innings. The game was ultimately decided by a solo home run from David Justice, sending the Braves to the World Series for the first time in Atlanta. This pivotal moment marked the beginning of a successful era for the franchise.
